content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find 5 beauty salons with ratings greater than 4.8 in Seattle, WA.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/maps/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find 5 beauty salons in Seattle, WA with ratings greater than 4.8, I need to first search for "beauty salons in Seattle, WA" on Google Maps. The search input box is identified by [0] and the search button is [1].
Action: Type [0]; beauty salons in Seattle, WA
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.1
token: : Type [0]; beauty salons in Seattle, WA

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see the search results for beauty salons in Seattle, WA. To filter the results to only show those with ratings greater than 4.8, I should use the filter for "Rating". The "Rating" filter button is labeled [4].
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The available rating filter options only go up to 4.5, but I need salons with ratings greater than 4.8. Filtering by 4.5 will help to narrow down the results close to my requirement, after which I can manually check which ones have ratings above 4.8.
Action: Click [6] (4.5 star rating option)
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible results still only show salons with ratings of 4.7. To see more options and check for any salons with ratings greater than 4.8, I need to navigate to the next page of results using the "Next page" button [6].
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible results on this page also only show salons with ratings of 4.7. I need to check more entries for salons rated above 4.8, so I should continue to the next page using the "Next page" button [7].
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current page still shows only salons with ratings of 4.7. To locate salons with ratings higher than 4.8, I need to continue browsing more listings by moving to the next page.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results still only show salons with a 4.7 rating. I should try looking through additional pages to find salons with ratings above 4.8.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The displayed results are still for salons rated 4.7. I need to continue searching through more pages to find salons rated above 4.8.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible listings still only show salons rated at 4.7. I need to continue checking subsequent pages to find salons that have ratings greater than 4.8.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results continue to show salons with a 4.7 rating, not 4.8 or higher. To try to find any salons with a 4.8+ rating, I need to view more results by advancing to the next page.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current results still only display salons with a 4.7 rating. To find salons with a rating greater than 4.8, I need to continue looking through more listings by advancing to the next page.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results still only show salons with a 4.7 rating. To find those rated above 4.8, I need to keep moving through the next pages of results.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results again show only beauty salons with a 4.7 rating. I still do not see any salons with a rating above 4.8. I need to keep navigating forward to see if any higher-rated salons appear on the next page.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results once again only show salons rated at 4.7. Since there is still no evidence of salons rated over 4.8, I must persist in flipping through more result pages to search for any with 4.8+ ratings.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.85

Thought: All visible salons are still rated at 4.7—none meet the requirement of 4.8 or higher. I have cycled through many pages without finding higher ratings. It seems there may not be any salons rated above 4.8 in Seattle, WA, at least within the listings displayed by Google Maps.

Action: ANSWER; No beauty salons with ratings greater than 4.8 were found in Seattle, WA on Google Maps. All visible listings have a maximum rating of 4.7.
Confidence: 1
Completion: 1
